pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:6.2: At that time a brahmin had prepared a milk-drink for the Order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:6.3: The monks drank the milk making a slurping sound,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:6.4: and a monk who was previously an entertainer said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:6.5: “It’s as if the whole Order were cooled.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:7.1: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:7.3: “How could a monk joke about the Order?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:7.4: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:7.7: Foolish man, how can you joke about the Order?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:7.10: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:7.11: “Monks, one should not joke about the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:7.12: If a monk does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:7.13: After criticizing that monk in many ways for being difficult to support … the Master said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:7.14: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:8.1: ‘“I will not slurp while eating,” this is how you should train.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:9.1: One should not slurp while eating.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:9.2: If a monk out of disrespect slurps while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:10.2): if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:10.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:11.1: The first training rule is finished.
